page.title: 02SHEEP-SHEARING
page.content: On Wednesday 19th June we went to watch the sheep shearing on one of the nearby farms. They have 1200 sheep altogether. They shear their tummy first then their legs. Then they turn them over and put their leg over their head.It takes 3mins. 5 seconds. The young sheep weigh 70 to 80 pounds. They roll the fleece up into a bundle and take the dirty bits off. They shear 120 sheep in a morning. All the sheep which have had lambs have red marks on them. Each fleece weighs 8 to 10 lbs. and is worth about Â£4.00. A gang of four men come to shear the sheep helped by three of the regular farm workers and three sheepdogs. It is one of the few farms in the area which still practises mixed farming.
